findings.reasoning: This finding identifies a real vulnerability in the convertCredentials function where dx is added twice to accountCreditsMap[0]. The attack scenario is concrete and profitable, and the fix suggestion is valid. However, it is not the TARGET vulnerability (reentrancy in append_availableresources).

This finding identifies a real vulnerability where token1 is not transferred to the user when removing liquidity. The attack scenario is concrete and results in loss of funds. However, it is not the TARGET vulnerability.
This finding identifies a real vulnerability where an attacker can receive ETH without providing token1. The attack scenario is concrete and profitable. However, it is not the TARGET vulnerability.

notes: None of the findings address the TARGET vulnerability (reentrancy in append_availableresources due to Vyper compiler bug). The root cause (Vyper compiler bug in @nonreentrant decorator) and location (append_availableresources function) are not matched by any finding. All findings are valid but unrelated to the TARGET vulnerability.
